page.title: 11THE CHICKSANDS PRIORY
page.content: {The Chicksands Priory}is one of two manors which made up the Chicksands estate,recorded in the Domesday Survey of 1086.In 1150, the Priorywas granted to the Gilbertine religious order. It eventually became the third largest monastery in the order, and one of only nine religious houses in the order to enclose both nuns and canons. The tale most often told about the old building has to be that of the "fallen nun"named Rosata. She had a friendship with one of the canons,which blossomed to a love affair, ending in pregnancy.As punishment, the Prior, upon finding out, sentenced her to be walled up alive in the cloisters after witnessing the execution of her lover. It is said that Rosata walks the grounds of the Priory on the 17th of every month in search of her lover.
